p: There is growing evidence of AIV reassortment at stopover sites, where migratory flyways intersect and thus, the frequency of intercontinental reassortment is likely a reflection of overlapping migratory pathways [ 58, 59, 60]. In this context, the reassortment of H2N9 may have occurred in Russian territory as both East Asian-Australasian and Central Asian flyways converge there (dotted line in Figure 1).
